title: Removing fonts in XP
content:
I have a number of fonts that I'd like to remove permanently from my computer. (windows XP),   
these include:   
Frankin   
Marlett   
Microsoft Sans   
Sydnie   
Webdings   
ZWAdobeF   
ITC American Typewriter   
Antiaue Olive   
Banco   
ITC Bookman   
Carta   
BrushScript   
Adobe Caslon   
Cooper   
Eccentric   
ITC Eras   
ITC Flora   
Kaufmann   
ITC Machine   
ITC Officina   
Serpentine   
Sonata   
Listho   
ITC Lubalin   
   
these are the worst offenders, there are others.   
I've tried searching for the files but the system doesnt find them, and have deleted everything except the essentials (Arial, Courier, Verdana, Tahoma) from the Fonts folder in the control panel.   
Some fonts appear in some applications and not others. Eventually I'd like as few typefaces loaded permanently as possible.   
Anyone know how to acheive this?
author: miles

comments.content:
\>Some fonts appear in some applications and not others.   
   
Try C:/Program Files/Common Files/Adobe/Fonts   
   
Some of them might be there.
Also, I'm not sure you can get rid of Marlett or Microsoft Sans. For what reason I don't know.

Don't delete - these   
   
Franklin Gothic (medium and medium italic)   
Marlett   
Microsoft Sans   
   
As there are all fonts used by the user interface. Marlett and MicroSS can't easily be deleted as they are 'system file protected'.   
   
All of the others, except Webdings are not fonts that come with Windows, so removing them may break other apps (unlikely but possible).   
   
Cheers, Si
Miles you might have better luck with this question in the BUILD forum. I'll move this thread now.
